00061 typedef struct dvdid_hashinfo_s dvdid_hashinfo_t;
00062 typedef struct dvdid_fileinfo_s dvdid_fileinfo_t;
00063 
00064 typedef enum dvdid_medium_e dvdid_medium_t;
00065 typedef enum dvdid_dir_e dvdid_dir_t;
00066 typedef enum dvdid_file_e dvdid_file_t;
00067 
00068 
00069 struct dvdid_fileinfo_s {
00070   /* Creation time as a Win32 FILETIME */
00071   uint64_t creation_time;
00072 
00073   /* Lowest 32bits of file size (explicitly, the 
00074      value stoted on the physical medium, which is
00075      not necessarily the value reported by the OS
00076      for (S)VCDs) */
00077   uint32_t size;
00078 
00079   /* Filename, uppercases, in ASCII */
00080   char *name;
00081 };
00082 
00083 
00084 DVDID_API(dvdid_status_t) dvdid_calculate2(uint64_t *discid, const dvdid_hashinfo_t *hi);
00085 
00086 /* Create a hashinfo struct.  Returns non-zero on error */
00087 DVDID_API(dvdid_status_t) dvdid_hashinfo_create(dvdid_hashinfo_t **hi);
00088 
00089 /* Set/get the media type.  Defaults to DVDID_TYPE_DVD for backwards 
00090   compatibility.  Set this before adding file info / data. */
00091 DVDID_API(dvdid_status_t) dvdid_hashinfo_set_medium(dvdid_hashinfo_t *hi, dvdid_medium_t medium);
00092 DVDID_API(dvdid_medium_t) dvdid_hashinfo_get_medium(const dvdid_hashinfo_t *hi);
00093 
00094 /* Add a file to the hashinfo struct.  The fileinfo will be copied, 
00095   and memory allocated as appropriate.  Returns non-zero on error, in
00096   which case dvdid_hashinfo_free must be called on the hashinfo struct
00097   as it's not guaranteed to be useable */
00098 DVDID_API(dvdid_status_t) dvdid_hashinfo_add_fileinfo(dvdid_hashinfo_t *hi, dvdid_dir_t dir, const dvdid_fileinfo_t *fi);
00099 
00100 /* Add the data read from various key files on the medium .  This buffer 
00101   will be copied, so does not need to be valid until dvd_hashinfo_free is
00102   called.  Only call this once (per file to be added). */
00103 /* We need at most the first DVDID_HASHINFO_FILEDATE_MAXSIZE bytes of the file */
00104 #define DVDID_HASHINFO_FILEDATA_MAXSIZE 0x10000
00105 DVDID_API(dvdid_status_t) dvdid_hashinfo_add_filedata(dvdid_hashinfo_t *hi, dvdid_file_t file, const uint8_t *buf, size_t size);
00106 
00107 /* Having added the necessary files and data,  perform any additional init 
00108   work before dvdid_calculate2 gets called */
00109 DVDID_API(dvdid_status_t) dvdid_hashinfo_init(dvdid_hashinfo_t *hi);
00110 
00111 /* Free hashinfo struct one finished with */
00112 DVDID_API(void) dvdid_hashinfo_free(dvdid_hashinfo_t *hi);
00113 
00114 
00115 /* From previous API, calls dvdid_hashinfo_add_file(hi, DVDID_DIR_VIDEO_TS, fi); */
00116 DVDID_API(dvdid_status_t) dvdid_hashinfo_addfile(dvdid_hashinfo_t *hi, const dvdid_fileinfo_t *fi);
00117 
00118 /* From previous API, calls dvdid_hashinfo_add_data(hi, DVDID_FILE_VMGI, buf, size); */
00119 #define DVDID_HASHINFO_VXXI_MAXBUF DVDID_HASHINFO_FILEDATA_MAXSIZE
00120 DVDID_API(dvdid_status_t) dvdid_hashinfo_set_vmgi(dvdid_hashinfo_t *hi, const uint8_t *buf, size_t size);
00121 
00122 /* From previous API, calls dvdid_hashinfo_add_data(hi, DVDID_FILE_VTS01I, buf, size); */
00123 DVDID_API(dvdid_status_t) dvdid_hashinfo_set_vts01i(dvdid_hashinfo_t *hi, const uint8_t *buf, size_t size);
